General.Text: Unit with fire extinguisher respond Code 2
Drive to the location and extinguish the ~r~fire~s~ or call the ~r~fire department!

Extingiush.Text: To get a ~r~fire extinguisher~s~, go to your trunk and press
Now search for ~y~evidence~s~ by pressing {Key} while in the ~y~markers~s~.

Tasks.Text: Press {MusicMenuKey} anytime to view the picture again!

Caller.Dialogue: Hello, are you the one who called in the burning trash?
Yes, that's me. I wanted to report a suspicious person I saw.
I was walking past the trash can when I saw a person walking away.
Right after that the fire started to burn!
This sounds suspicious, do you have details on the suspect?
Sure, it was a {gender} and around {age} years old.
I was able to take a photo, here it is!
Thanks, we're looking for the suspect now. Bye!

Evidence.Dialogue: A Molotov cocktail, this was no accident... someone wanted to start a fire.
A jerrycan full of gasoline, looks like someone was preparing to ignite something.
A bong? Strange... maybe someone was too high to notice the fire they started.
A frag grenade. This is no simple fire, we're dealing with something far more dangerous.
A smoke grenade. Could have been used to cover up their tracks before setting the fire.
A broken bottle. It seems improvised, but it could have been used to start the fire.
A gas cylinder. If this went off, the whole area could've gone up in flames.
An oil drum. It's leaking... and highly flammable. Looks like someone wanted to spread the fire.
A petrol can. Smells like gasoline... someone really wanted to burn this place down.
A sock? Well, it might not seem like much, but it smells bad enough to be a fire hazard.
Typical. Somebody threw a burning cigarette in the trash, then it started igniting.
A sock? Well, it might not seem like much, but it smells bad enough to be a fire hazard.
